title: Osteogenesis Imperfecta in Children
description: Doctors at Hassenfeld Children's Hospital at NYU Langone work with families to help children who have osteogenesis imperfecta live more safely. Learn more.
cleaned_text: We use cookies and similar tools to give you the best website experience. By using our site, you accept our Websites Privacy Policy. When your child is receiving medical care, we can help make the experience easier for your whole family. Whether you're bringing your child for a well-child visit, surgery, or hospital stay, we can help you and your family prepare for the experience. We strive to provide your family with the most advanced medical care possible, in a family-centered environment. Orthopedic experts at Hassenfeld Children's Hospital at NYU Langone and NYU Langone Orthopedic Hospital are experienced in distinguishing between everyday bone fractures and osteogenesis imperfecta, a lifelong genetic condition that weakens bones and makes them more susceptible to fractures. Our orthopedists collaborate with a team of pediatricians, genetic counselors, endocrinologists, radiologists, dentists, hearing specialists, and physical and occupational therapists to address all aspects of this condition. Families are our most important partners in caring for children. Get age-specific tips on how to talk with your child about receiving medical care. We can help you find a Hassenfeld Children's Hospital doctor. Call 646-929-7970 or browse our specialists.
